intro: Silene thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink or purple flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene thurberi is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
